tips.summary: In the first 2 turns, instead of going AFK, try to freeze a value generating minion that you then use on your discovery turn to level to tavern 2 (ex: sellemental/swabie etc.). I usually follow up by going Tavern 3 on 6 gold and then playing normally but it depends on what shop you get on tavern 2. If you don't get a value start, I'd still recommend leveling to 2 on 5 gold in most cases.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Naga/Quilboar/Demons/Undead for strong tier 3s. play just for tempo, buddy is bad.
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Playing 'Rafaam Curve' is risky because if you don't get Block and a few Competitive Spirits you're going to fall behind on board so only do it if you're offered really good minions. Otherwise just play normally and hero power mid-game when you have some gold left and prioritize Ice Block.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Your heropower is ice block and splitting image; macaw + titus with buddy can cheese games
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Level a bit more aggressively than on a normal hero and make use of your hero power early/mid-game. Towards late-game, people can play around it more efficiently with cards like Leeroy.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Good early tempo, macaw and cleave synergy late, buddy is a guaranteed golden selfless
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to map your leveling path up to 5 and go there as soon as possible without taking way too much damage. Sometimes even the basic curve followed by skipping taverns 3 and 4 could be a good way to play this hero! (7gold = tavern 3, 8 gold = tavern 4, 9 gold = tavern 5 and get your hero power activated).
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Very vulnerable and highrolly, buddy on tier 6 is guaranteed kalecgos and doubles with brann
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to pick minions that are good on their own, not around a combo (at least for 2 and 4 stars). If you don't hit a 6 drop that creates your gameplan, pick something like Queen/Uther and play normally after you go to tavern 4, you don't always need to rush to 6.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Mainly focus on your 6; it needs to be strong and directional enough to level for.
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: On this hero I recommend underleveling and focussing around a tavern 2 strategy such as elementals or murlocs. It's a very meta-game dependant hero which either is really good or unplayable.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy is good, heropower is bad, don't get baited by low tier strategies
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Just win the bets, LOL.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Coins are spells for naga synergy, buddy is extremely high value
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Ideally play defensive until one player dies. That is not always possible so sometimes it's okay to play like a normal hero but think this: Before a player dies, you are the worst hero in the game. The more players die the stronger you become so play accordingly!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Very strong buddy, very weak heropower - don't be afraid to spend some gold getting the buddy faster
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Power Leveling seems best on this hero to get value out of the hero power while it's still valuable.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy synergy is very good with Prophet of the Boar and Bristlemane Scrapsmith
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: If there are enough battlecries on tavern 1, I like staying there until I get the Brann and then level while dealing a lot of damage to opponents.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Make sure there's enough battlecries on tier 1 before you choose brann, golden buddy gives full value even with limited board space
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: This hero plays best on tavern 4 with avenge minions that you can ''milk'' utilising earth invocation. Late-game you almost always want to use Lightning Invocation to break opponent's divine shields and give yourself an edge in the fights.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Free tempo early; golden buddy is strong with titus and a cleave
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I recommend following the Rafaam curve(leveling on 6,7,8 gold and then playing normally), builds a strong board and gives you a high chance to triple as well! Best with solid, tanky minions that you wouldn't mind keeping until mid/late-game.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Shields are good, buddy to make heropower +5/+3 or +3/+5
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Even if you don't have to end up as elementals every game, when you pick this hero you should know most games will end up like that. Ideally you buy a lot of cheap elementals and don't even pay for leveling, advancing through the taverns while building a powerful board.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Don't hard focus on elementals early: get strong early, and your buddy will provide the elementals afterwards
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: With a value generator start, Cookie is one of the best heroes in the game at snowballing. If you have that start, try to level quickly and get good minions to help you snowball. Go for stats over synergies early and only build on a win-condition once you get a minion that can support it! If you don't have a value start, Cookie can still offer you some gold or powerfull minions to smoothen your curve.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Need to have a very good reason not to 3 on 3
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play normally until you get a good board, then hero power every turn. You can still hero power if it's the best play that turn(example:5gold and you don't have a value start that allows you to double buy) but don't go out of your way to press it every turn. You should press it every turn if you build around Dragons with Whelp Smuggler however since you'd like to maximize health in that case.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Only heropower when the gold is efficient; find a gameplan besides heropower, buddy is bad
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Don't focus too much around the hero power, sometimes it's okay to sell it if it falls behind and you found a better gameplan.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Focus on minion types before picking curator; murloc/dragon/elemental to buff are needed
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Plays best when building around minions that summon, such as rat pack when beasts are available or deflecto and resets when mechs are available.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Undead are key, Deathrattles and Divine Shields help
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Best way to play this hero is to make big minions and stay most of the game on Tavern 3. Once you go to 4, you get shown 5 minions instead of 4 which makes targeting one minion in the shop much more random and inconsistent.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy is bad, heropower can't keep up with buddies. Shields are good, don't worry about leveling "on time"
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like going for divine shield builds on this hero to capitalize on the bonus attack.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Mostly reliant on magnetics with buddy buffs
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I recommend almost never leveling on turn 2 (unless you have token start) because your hero power is very useful in the first turns at winning you fights by making one or a few powerful minions!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: bad buddy, bad heropower, don't
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like hero powering until it costs 5, that's too much most of the time. I generally use the first hero power for tempo and then, if the game goes badly I use them for more tempo, otherwise I try to discover 5 or 6 drops and snowball the game from there!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy lets you heropower a lot, so don't be afraid to use heropowers early
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play normally and sometimes you get good minions offered, it's a pretty versatile hero that doesn't really change your playstyle.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Bad buddy, hugely inconsistent heropower
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Economy buddies are a must, they're only found on tier 3+
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like starting to hero power on turn 2, build a strong board and finish my first dig on tavern 4 discovering a 5. Afterwards, I go for a second dig only if I have the money to press the hero power but I don't go out of my way to press it. Some players don't even bother with a second dig and just use the boost from the first one and then ignore the hero power completely.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy scaling is not enough to win; ignore it for the most part and play to find a normal comp
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Pick this hero if you have no tier 1 options. A great advantage is that you can see the starting shop before you make your pick but don't make your pick ONLY around the starting shop.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Get buddies cheaper than you normally would, as long as they're tier 4 or higher
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Don't level too quickly! Focus on building the board and stay a bit more on taverns 2/3 if the game is going badly. Also, since you're probably building murlocs try to not buy too many of the other minions since you'll have to sell them later(if you have the option to).
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Heropower becomes useful once you have Brann, use buddy on tier 4s for ball and primalfin
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Only hero power turn 1 if you have token start, otherwise it's fine to start on 2. Don't be too greedy with the discovery, if you get a very good tempo minion, pick it and use it's power to level and that will enable you to discover a win-condition at the right time without risking your hp.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: don't repeatedly heropower and freeze one minion; losing early fights and getting one tier 6 doesn't keep up with buddies
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Depending on the lobby, think what you want to discover and in what sequence. This usually will help you understand if you want to pick gold or +2/+2 after the first discovery in order to either discover a 4, a 5 or a 6 with the 2nd discover. A cool curve is to go discover > 2 gold > discover and play basic leveling. That allows you to buy a minion on 8 gold when leveling from tavern 3 to 4 and smoothens out the curve for you to just rush 6 and snowball the lobby (Best in metagames where you want to rush 6/discover 6).
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Use the 2 turn option turn 1, then the 3 turn option, time the first buddy to double up on the discover
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Economy is king. Buy every minion that gives you more gold over 2 turns. Key is to be strong as much as you can early game because everyone is going to try to damage/kill you. Underleveling can sometimes work but sometimes taking a bit of damage to be tavern 4 faster is worth it because you can stabilise easier there.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Focus on economy (elementals, murlocs, pirates), buddy is free tempo not a win condition
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to use a shield or two on some big minion early to put yourself in a good spot and then play normally and use shields when you have leftover gold or on powerful targets such as poison minions. Keep in mind to not fully relly on your hero power since people can play Blaster against you!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Toxfin and Greasebot can help win, shielding early is okay when your buddy scales them
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play normally and abuse the tempo you get from a few minions that summon to level at least to tavern 5 and build something sticky and synergistic from there. Reborn is not always great because the reborned minion is going to be taunted (I don't recommend Mama comps on Greybough or at least don't reborn it).
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Deathrattles and Reborns can out-tempo a lobby, Kangor's Apprentice comps can win against strong boards
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like buying strong 1 drop rather than token/value and following up with buying a strong 2 drop and hero powering on 5 gold. From there only hero power when you have 2 gold at the end of the turn and don't go too much out of your way to use it.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: First buddy gives a tier 5 and 6 that define your game, second set of buddies usually comes too late
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: With token/value start I like 3 on 3 or even 4 on 4 followed by hero powering. With a worse start, play normal curve but try to get a token or something you'd like to sell on 6 gold to hero power on that turn. Follow up by going tavern 3 and then immediately to 4 and hero power again on 4 before considering leveling to 5/6.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Wait longer with your first buddy until more people spiked higher tier minions
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like staying on 1 and trying to make value out of thin air by hero powering a value minion(best is cat) and trying to generate another value minion. Use the value that you get to snowball, level aggressively and triple into either a 4/5/6 and win the game from there!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Alleycat (and sellemental/shell collector), golden buddy prints tons of gold
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Be careful not to have a queen in your hero power slots because hero power activates before start of turn effects! Try to play a build around cleave/divine shields for best usage of hero power.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Less need to focus on a full board, very strong buddy
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: You can under-level slightly with this hero to make use of your hero power early game and then follow up by using your powerful board to level to 6 and go for end-game. Some strategies can just stay on 4 all the game though, it depends on the meta-game.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Very bad buddy, bad heropower, even a good lobby (undead+demon) isn't that good
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Build around summoning minions but make sure to have a divine shield or cleave to put your buffs on once your hero power becomes big enough.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Demons/Undead (for summons) and Mechs (for shields) are a must, buddy fuels heropower and avenge well
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: You need an alleycat on Jandice, do your best to find one! If it's not in your starting shop, you want to roll once turn 2 (not more than that since you'll lose the game) and if you don't get a cat until turn 3 just give up and play normally and try to save the start with more defensive plays.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Alleycat triples, Brann+Primalfin, Glowscale, Nomi, buddy can scale anything
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: You don't need to force demons, 1 big demon is enough so that you have a hero power target in most turns. Also, since the hero power is not THAT good, don't forcefully use it every turn, use it only when appropriate.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy prints money and triples, heropower is usually bad (but better than rolling at the end of a turn)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play basic curve or 3 on 3 most of the games, try to put stats on a divine shield or beefy minion (high health minions are best to be buffed).
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: The heropower stats basically don't matter, buddy stats do - deflect-o-bot is best
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: In the past most people were hero powering on 7 gold to level from 2 to 4. Now I think best is to keep it for when you level to tavern 5 and use it there for a very powerful turn.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Don't spend too much gold on your buddy
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: This hero plays best with a basic curve, followed by 8 gold=3 buy by selling one of your minions, 9 gold=3 sell 4 buy, 10 gold=5 sell 5 buy to activate the hero power. Doesn't work that well in meta-games where 5/6 drops dominate, there you should just play like you don't have a hero power most of the time, lol.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Very bad buddy, wants to level very slowly and out-tempo in the midgame (aiming for 3rd/4th)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Getting an early spellcraft is really good, this way you can guarantee that you get value every turn from your hero power's passive! Would still buy economy over Mini-Myrmidon on 1. When strong, level to 5/6 for glowscale/greta spell.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Passive heropower >> active heropower, very bad buddy
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Craziest thing about this hero is that you DON'T always have to level fast to 3 or 4. Almost always you go tavern 2 on turn 1 but afterwards you level only if you get bad shops. Buying solid board is priority so you stop taking damage. Demons make this hero a lot better just because of Kathra'natir.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy prevents health loss from heropower, HP and level turn 1, HP and double buy turn 2
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play Rafaam curve and try to hero power on 1 since that gives you a power spike earlier. Don't be too greedy with the triples, if you're losing a lot of fights it's okay to take a 3 or a 4 drop instead of going for 5 or 6's.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Rafaam for triples, first buddy for another triple discovery. Brann the buddy or play two in a row before HP to get the golden minion next turn
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to make value out of nothing, best target is alley cat since you can use one minion to make two.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Alleycat early to get extra minions on board, use the buddy to get high tier direction and strength
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: If you get a really bad shop and your board is strong enough for the turn, just level. It's a bigger risk to start rolling. This hero plays at its best on 6 where you have most minions shown to you per roll.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Find a gameplan that lets you buy & sell many things, with buddy you barely need to roll
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Buy every menace you can if you're forcing mechs but keep in mind you don't always need to force mechs, even on this hero. Sometimes the game leads you in a different direction.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: buddy + kangor's + titus isn't very reliable as a gameplan, but it's usually the only thing you can do
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like staying on 1 a bit more and playing the 'Rafaam curve' while buffing one or two minions a lot. I preffer to buff 1 minion (ideally pupbot) but it depends on the meta-game.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Save bananas for the first buddy, bananas are spells for Athissa
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Really good to hero power leeroy/queen late game. Until then try to get value hero powering a deathrattle or a minion with a good effect.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Entirely reliant on Undead, heropower on Leeroy lategame
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Use the coins to level agressively if needed or just buy a strong board. From there snowball into a win-condition.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: It's worth spending quite a lot of gold to get your buddy (it will pay itself back fast)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to first build one big minion. From there you can build a board that synergizes with that one minion and can go crazy!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: get one big minion early to make the first buddy big fast, spit those stats back onto themselves for the second set of buddies
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to think of short term rather than going too long. If you pick short term hero power every turn you're more likely to win. Greedy picks are usually a bait.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Economy heropowers early, high value&tempo heropowers later
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: In the early game, use the hero power to get economy, followed by a powerful board and then use that to get to your win-condition. The hero power is more useful in the early part of the game so don't rely on it too much later.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy is mostly useful for felbat synergy (and not much else)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: In early mid game, just try to be strong because you can't always build around your hero power. Sometimes it's just going to be a 1 gold 2/2 and that's okay.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Leapers and Boomboxes (quite inconsistent)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: If the initial shop is bad(no token/value generator), you can stay a bit on one and then power level afterwards.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Needs economy starts to level fast & efficiently, wants to get her buddy asap
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to build deathrattle/summon oriented, works best with something like Ghastcoiler.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Pretty bad buddy, heropower can't compete with buddies
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play a bit around your hero power in the early part of the game but late-game you can even play 7 minions and forget about it.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Don't hyper focus on the buddy; one big tentacle is not a win condition
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to not buy non-pirate minions because it's going to make forcing pirates way harder. If you get no pirates at all it's fine to go for another build but don't pivot back into pirates afterwards.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy can buff non-pirates and works with brann, playing around Mech shields and Murloc poisons is hard
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Play a bit more greedy than usual (more leveling) to make use of your extra HP.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Health is a resource; Mechs/Demons/Undead for midgame strength
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: The first hero power I like to use on tavern 3 or 4 and try to get coin generator. If the game is going well, use the other 2 hero powers on 6, if the game goes badly use one or even both hero powers for tempo.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Heropower turn 2 looking for Foul Egg + Risen Rider to win early fights, buddy is good tempo (not direction)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: An optimal number for this hero power is +5 health. At that ammount or even higher if you want to be a bit greedy you should start hero powering every turn to make your board sticky.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy is often very bad, heropower around +4/+5 health is usually best
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: When you are getting close to activating your hero power, try to plan ahead and think what is the most optimal way of getting the attack that also allows you to discover one minion.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: With Athissa and Greta, sell your first buddy and keep two regular buddies; each spellcraft gets cast 5 times
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Hero power every turn in the begining of the game, your objective is to build a strong board and try to triple as much as possible. Level on 6 gold to tavern 2 and 7 gold to tavern 3. From there depending on the meta you either rush tavern 4/5 or stay a bit more on 3.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Rafaam curve is called rafaam curve for a reason, buddy is okay for extra economy, not fantastic
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to slightly under-level and finish your hero power, then buff divine shields or cleaves!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Demons & Undead so opponents have summons to activate heropower, buddy has many synergies outside of HP
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Avoid Rafaam curve. If anything, level aggressively to taverns 3/4 and hero power there, ideally on divine shields.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Terrible buddy, terrible heropower, stay away
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to power level while having a powerful board. Don't be greedy with the discoveries since leveling while keeping health is more important.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: On Tier 1 discovers aren't random; guaranteed economy is good, tier 1 buddy means it's reliably tripled
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I like playing on tavern 1 until I hit a triple, level to 4 and discover a 5 with the triple. Other playstyle is to powerlevel to 3 or to 4 and hero power a good, value generating minion there and build around it.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy can provide early tempo and a guaranteed triple
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Best to build around divine shields on this hero.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Shields are good
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to build around divine shielded minions, also know that your hero power works on magnetic minions for buffing a mech multiple times!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Shields are good, heropower stacks over turns if you don't buy a minion between heropowers
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Curve depends on what your opponents are doing. Either way, try to play kind of safe until you hit a win condition, then you can go crazy!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Scout the lobby for good buddies to decide if your buddy is worth spending a lot of gold on
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to play as many battlecries as possible before using your shudderlings, ideally with Brann. If you drop under damage cap or at risk or dying or taking a lot of damage that you want to avoid, it's okay to use your shudderlings then.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Shell Collector & Deck Swabbie give money early, Murlocs give the most useful heropower targets later
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Prioritize ticket minions but don't go too crazy, don't buy EVERY single ticket minion and if something good shows up in the shop, buy it even if it doesn't come with a ticket.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Good minions without tickets are often better than bad minions with tickets, hold discovers in hand if you get the buddy soon
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Buy either the token/value generator or the lowest health minion. Then freeze the rest and play basic curve while buying strong minions. Use your strong board to carry you to taverns 5/6 and there look for a win-condition.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddies that print money are almost never bad, and Sindragosa is no exception
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to plan to pick a quest that is good for the lobby you're playing and focus on finish it as fast as possible, without going too much out of your way until the last turn or so of the quest.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Prioritize easy-to-complete quests
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try hero powering as much as possible once you get to higher tavern tiers, especially once you first get to 3 or 4 and lategame on 6 drops!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy is a budget Fish of N'Zoth, but notably works with brann
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: You can either play Rafaam curve in a more aggro lobby or 3 on 3 and then start buffing those big minions!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Getting to the second set of buddies is really hard, so get all the value you can from the first buddy
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Best with Elementals where your smallest minion is still big but also decent with demons or dragons.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Heropower is free tempo, not direction - buddy is just a poison
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Your hero power carries your early game. I like shooting high until lategame when I shoot low to hit leeroy/queen.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: With your buddy, heropower specifically to dodge divine shields; no damage = no buffs
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Best with undead, try to get Eternal Knight and grow it and then try to get your hands on Eternal Summoner and Titus Rivendare afterwards. Make sure you have enough board space to summon all the knights!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Divine shield minion first maximizes buddy stats, heropower works well with Felstomper/Eternal Summoner
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Try to under-level, steal one good minion and build around it.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Don't be afraid to ignore the heropower earlygame, evaluate the lobby's buddies before committing too much gold to your buddy
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Plan for the prize turns and how you can use a good/bad outcome. Try to not rely too much on getting a good prize and have your own gameplay independent of the prizes, make them just be a bonus for something already great.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Sell your first buddy on turn 8 for a turn 12 prize, if you can wait until turn 12 to sell the second set of buddies it's gamewinning
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: I recommend the 'Toki Curve' whenever possible. Play basic curve until 6 gold where you level to tavern 3 and hero power. Freeze the 4 drops if at least one is good and next turn you can buy 2 minions and hero power!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Lots of midgame strength, less likely to get solid direction, much stronger with token starts
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Good with deathrattles and summons but can work with something like poison or just any comp decently.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Felbat eating demons with extra health is amazing, health-buffed magnetics are good too
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Plan your freezes to maximize chance to triple, don't be greedy with discoveries since if you're strong you can just level roll and set up an even better triple for the next turn. Always count how many minions you can freeze while still getting the hero power to work. For it to work, the ammount of frozen minions needs to be at least 1 lower than the minions shown for a roll at that tavern.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Don't be afraid to triple early, you can triple more later. Leave pairs frozen, triple them with heropower next turn for large stats with buddy buffs
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Very good with naga/quilboar and then moving temporary stats to a divine shield or cleave. Difficult to play early but once you have a good core you're unbeatable!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Heropower makes temporary stats permanent, has spellcraft synergy, divine shield&cleave are good
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: You can play 'Rafaam Curve' and play around your hero power or just ignore it and play as if you don't have a hero power depending on the meta-game/lobby.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Very bad buddy, barely noticable heropower, dooooon't
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Economy curve into triples is the best way to play, don't be too greedy with the triples because it's going to cost you in health since the minions you hero power are 2/2's and they usually don't carry fights.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Be careful to avoid having your buddy as your only relevant minion; you still want to find a normal comp
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Works with multiple curves depending on the meta but try to hero power as much as possible early and ignore it mid/late game. I pretty much only hero power late game if I have 2 left-over gold and I really don't want to roll.
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Gold efficient, good tempo, when selling buddy be prepared for it to eat the shop (buy minions first)
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: You have to force dragons on this hero, there are more aggressive ways of doing that like rushing taverns 3/4 or more conservative ways which build on tavern 1 before going 3/4. Depending on your rank and lobby you should figure out on the spot what works better for you!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Buddy is not very strong, tarecgosa & prized promo drake is hard to win with right now
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: King of leveling aggressively. Just be mindful of your health and of the good minions in that lobby. Once you snatch a good one you can build around it!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Heropower is good when leveling efficiently, buddy also buffs minions summoned by heropower
tips.author: curvesheet

tips.summary: Don't be too greedy with the first hero power, be mindful with the second hero power and greedy as hell with the third! Unless you are losing fights, in which case use all of them to stay alive as much as possible and save a bad game!
tips.author: rdu

tips.summary: Triple into a tier 5 on turn 6, buddy to get a pair of the tier 5 on turn 7, and heropower to triple it
tips.author: curvesheet

curves.name: Basic Curve
curves.notes: Stronger with a token start, turn 4 shop RNG weakness. No heropower requirement.

curves.name: Fast Basic Curve
curves.notes: Stronger with a token start, turn 4 shop RNG weakness. No heropower requirement.

curves.name: Jeef Curve
curves.notes: Uses tier 1 economy and strong pairs for a flexible start to the game with its variations.

curves.name: Fast Jeef Curve
curves.notes: Uses tier 1 economy and strong pairs for a flexible start to the game with its variations. Pushes levels quickly.

curves.name: Slow Jeef Curve
curves.notes: Uses tier 1 economy and strong pairs for a flexible start to the game with its variations. Stays on tier 2 to solidify the board.

curves.name: Warrior Curve
curves.notes: A highly valueable line if tier 1 economy and forced triples are strong.

curves.name: Extended Warrior Curve
curves.notes: A highly valueable line if tier 1 economy and forced triples are strong. This variant is a fallback option in case a triple hasn't shown up yet playing regular warrior curve.

curves.name: Basic Yogg Curve
curves.notes: Uses a 2-cost heropower to get to tier 3 faster.

curves.name: Aggro Yogg Curve
curves.notes: Uses a 2-cost heropower to get good tier 1s on board before leveling to 3 faster

curves.name: Rafaam Curve
curves.notes: Clean leveling using 1-cost heropower, 2-cost heropower with economy, or tavern tippers

curves.name: Slow Rafaam Curve
curves.notes: Clean leveling using 1-cost heropower, 2-cost heropower with economy, or tavern tippers. Cut off on tier 2 to get stronger

curves.name: 3 on 3 (Level on 8)
curves.notes: Sacrifices early health to get very fast access to tier 3 minions, then pushes levels

curves.name: 3 on 3 (Level on 9)
curves.notes: Sacrifices early health to fill the board with tier 3 minions

curves.name: 4 on 4
curves.notes: Sacrifices early health to get very fast access to tier 3 minions. A fallback option in case of a bad shop after 3 on 3; requires economy

curves.name: Toki Curve
curves.notes: A way to use 1 cost heropowers that don't provide tempo

curves.name: Pocky Curve
curves.notes: A very niche use for 1 cost heropowers
